intro.description:
This tutorial will demonstrate how to use the RCP tooling in PDE to create a fully-branded product.
To learn more about using cheat sheets, click the help button in the top right corner (?).

item.title: Create the product configuration
item.description: To create the product configuration, perform the following steps:

subitem.label: Select "File->New->Product Configuration" from the main menu to bring up the "New Product Configuration" wizard.
In the "New Product Configuration wizard", select the "org.eclipse.browser" project as the parent folder, then input "browser.product" into the "File name" text box.
Select the "Use a launch configuration" radio button inside the "Initialize the file content" section and press "Finish".

item.title: Define the product
item.description: To define the product, perform the following steps:

subitem.label: On the "Overview" page of the product editor, input "Eclipse Browser Product" into the "Product Name" text box.
Press the "New..." button next to the "Product ID" drop down menu to open the "New Product Definition" dialog box.
Select "org.eclipse.browser.application" from the list of available applications in the "Application" section. Press "Finish".

item.title: Add window images
item.description: To add window images, perform the following steps:

subitem.label: Select the "Branding" page of the product editor.
In the "Window Images" section, press the "Browse..." button adjacent to the "16x16" text box to select the "/org.eclipse.browser/branding/world_16-16_windows.gif" image. Press "OK".
In the "Window Images" section, press the "Browse..." button adjacent to the "32x32" text box to select the "/org.eclipse.browser/branding/world_32-32_windows.gif" image. Press "OK".

item.title: Customize the About dialog
item.description: To customize the About dialog, perform the following steps:

subitem.label: In the "About Text" section, press the "Browse..." button adjacent to the "Image" text box to select the "/org.eclipse.browser/branding/world_about.gif" image. Press "OK".
In the "Text" area, input "This is a blurb about my Eclipse Browser Product".

item.title: Run the RCP product
item.description: To run the RCP product, perform the following steps:

subitem.label: Save the "browser.product" file via File > Save from the main menu.
On the "Overview" page of the product editor, click the "Launch the product" hyperlink under the "Testing" heading. Note the splash screen upon launching.
Note how the application window now has the title "Eclipse Browser Product" in the title bar.
Note how the application window has an image depicting the world in the top-left corner. The same image appears in the task bar at the bottom.
Press Alt-Tab (on Windows) to see your RCP application among the list of running applications, represented with a larger 48x48 icon.
Bring up the "About" dialog by selecting "Help > About Eclipse Browser Product" from the main menu of the application window. Verify that you see your custom text and image in the "About" dialog.
Exit the RCP application via "File > Exit" from the main menu of the application window.

item.title: Customize the launcher (Windows Only)
item.description: To customize the launcher, perform the following steps:

subitem.label: Select the "Launcher" page of the product editor.
Input "browser" into the "Launcher Name" text box under the "Program Launcher" heading.
Select the "win32" tab under the "Program Launcher" heading and select the "Use a single ICO file containing 7 images as specified above" radio button.
Press the "Browse..." button adjacent to the "File" text box to select the "/org.eclipse.browser/branding/world_launcher.ico" file. Press "OK".
Select "File->Save" from the main menu.

item.title: Export the product
item.description: To export the plug-in based product, perform the following steps:

subitem.label: Select the "Overview" page of the product editor.
Click the "Eclipse Product export wizard" hyperlink under the "Exporting" heading to bring up the "Eclipse Product" export wizard.
Input "browser" in the "Root directory" text field contained in the "Product Configuration" section.
Input a destination directory in the "Directory" text fiedl in the "Destination" section (e.g. "C:\destination" for Windows) and press "Finish".

item.title: Browse the finished product
item.description: To browse the exported plug-in based product directory, perform the following steps:

subitem.label: Navigate your file system to the destination directory specified in the previous step (e.g. "C:\destination" for Windows)
Note the presence of the "browser" subdirectory. Expand it and examine the structure of your product. A "plugins" subdirectory containing all plug-ins, a "configuration" containing metadata.
Note the custom "browser" launcher with a branded icon ("browser.exe" on Windows) at the root of the "browser" directory.
Double-click on the "browser" executable to launch the product.
Observe the RCP product you created that is fully executable outside the Eclipse workspace.
Exit the product via "File > Exit" from the main menu.
